Title: Software Developer - Python
Job_Description:
Dreaming big is in our DNA. Brewing the world’s most loved beers and creating meaningful experiences is what inspires us. We are owners, empowered to lead real change, deliver on tough challenges, and take accountability for the results. We are looking for talent that shares these values, that is ambitious, bold & resilient. We want talent that is looking for fast career growth, cross-functional experiences, global exposure and robust training & development.
WORK LOCATIONS: St. Louis, MO - New York City, NY - Denver, CO - Miami, FL - Austin, TX
Salary: $98,000 - $152,000 (pending location)
COMPANY:
Michelob ULTRA. Cutwater Spirits. Budweiser. Kona Brewing Co. Stella Artois. Bud Light. That’s right, over 100 of America’s most loved brands, to be exact. But there’s so much more to us than our top-notch portfolio of beers, seltzers, and more. We are powered by a 19,000-strong team that shares our passion to create a future with more cheers. We look for people with talent, curiosity, and commitment and provide the teammates, resources and opportunities to unleash their full potential. The power we create together – when we combine your strengths with ours – is unstoppable. Are you ready to join a team that dreams as big as you do?
ROLE SUMMARY:
The Team
“TechOps” is a team that is well rooted with the business and the functions inside Anheuser-Busch and covers both United States and Canada as a North American Zone (NAZ). In TechOps, you will design, build, test, and support software products that continue to be a competitive advantage to our business. You will act as a technical Subject Matter Expert (SME), and partner with others to deliver sustainable solutions and successful end-user experiences.
The Job
As a Software Engineer specializing in API development, you will be key to enabling the flow of data and its underlying transactions through building and interacting with APIs in applications and services. You will work on a DevOps software engineering team dedicated to building enterprise applications with the latest and greatest cloud-first technology to enable key parts of our business. From contributing to new applications to enhancing existing products, you will work amongst a team of passionate software engineers, facilitated by a scrum master, with work prioritized by product owners.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Title: Software Developer - Python
Job_Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

The Senior UI Software Engineer will help modernize our Online Billing Application and Group Management Experience. Along with writing effective code, the position will be responsible for designing, building, delivering and maintaining a highly scalable set of products and applications. The incumbent will use industry best practices and work collaboratively with cross-functional team of product managers, UX designers, architects, principal engineers, software engineers, test automation team and DevOps engineers.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As a senior engineer, drives and implements a variety of new cutting edge, business-critical projects that require fast, slick and extendable UI using the latest tools and libraries.
Designs, develops, and maintains responsive, accessible web applications providing user experiences on desktop and mobile devices. Writes high quality front-end with attention to scalability, security, and performance.
Performs as a key contributor to an engineering team that builds and supports exceptional products that provide innovative solutions to challenging business use cases, existing system and operational problems.
Participates in architectural design, system analysis, and programming activities on application software; this may often require independent research and study.
Develops high-quality and production-ready software by using best-practice data structures, algorithms, design patterns, and frameworks that are maintainable, scalable, responsive, and secure.
Writes highest quality code with utmost attention to scalability, security and performance and with an end-to-end mindset from conception to delivery and production support, owning specifications, quality, release deployments and monitoring of production health.
Produces complete, simple, and readable technical documentation for everything developed and maintains a team culture of documenting everything.
Tests and ensures quality of all code that developed in line with principles of test-driven development and continuous delivery, utilizing test automation frameworks wherever possible.
Participates in code-reviews, provides technical guidance and mentors software engineers.
Collaborates closely with Engineering leadership, Product Managers, Designers, Test Automation and other teams and business units to define, prioritize, sequence and scope business and functional requirements and drive results.
Instruments infrastructure and application performance monitoring, capacity management, alerting, tools instrumentation and metrics (KPI) management.
Performs impact assessment of product (hardware, software) upgrades.
Assists in planning, coordinating, and executing engineering projects.
Supports and collaborates with other Engineers through evaluation, design analysis, and development phases.
Maintains knowledge, ensures competency and compliance with policies and procedures, in order to be the technical expert while collaborating with cross-functional teams.
This list is not all-inclusive and you are expected to perform other duties as requested or assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience.
5 to 7 years of experience designing and developing secure consumer-facing responsive, accessible user experiences and interfaces for web applications.
Expert level knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, Responsive web design, Accessibility (WCAG 2.0 AA).
Intermediate level knowledge of JavaScript Programming.
3+ years of extensive experience building production application with ReactJS.
2+ years of extensive experience in CSS preprocessors like Sass or Less.
1+ years of experience building responsive Single Page Web Applications.
1+ years of experience building production application with Node.js.
Good understanding of design principles to build a scalable applications.
Advocate, advise, and implement - user-centered design, mobile first methodology, progressive enhancement and graceful degradation, accessibility, SEO, responsive design, and website performance.
Proficiency with Chrome and/or other browser Developer Tools.
Proficiency with Git/Github or other distributed version control systems.
Experience with Scrum, Agile Process.
Experience with Azure is preferred
Proficient with writing unit test case using any of the testing framework like Jest, Enzyme, Jasmine etc.
Ability to understand business plans and apply that information into the development of an IT business case.
Anticipates problems, resistance or likely objections and takes action to resolve them.
Ability to lead and manage small to large enterprise network implementations or changes.
Ability to guide, train and mentor associate engineers.
Highly skilled in developing quantitative cost/benefit analysis to measure improvements.
Proficient in organizational processes as well as capable of assessing and initiating change of such processes.
Demonstrates an in-depth knowledge and application of competency and can consult as well as lead others in its application.
Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills.
Knowledge of agile development methodologies.
Ability to develop and maintain key vendor relationships with a focus on technology currency and best practices.
Life-long learner, process improver.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Rewards to make you smile! We don't just want to make our customers happy - we want to give our employees a reason to smile, too. Delta Dental's comprehensive benefits package includes:

Generous paid time off plus 12 holidays and your birthday off!

100% paid dental and vision insurance

Social responsibility and volunteer opportunities, including 16 paid volunteer hours annually
Employee LiveWell program, focusing on overall employee well-being

career development and tuition reimbursement

ABOUT THE TEAM

At Delta Dental, our success is only as strong as the people who execute it! We take enormous pride in being the nation's most recognized and widely-used provider of dental insurance - and we've come this far by living our core values of innovation, excellence, service and trust. Our vision is to motivate and empower every employee so that we're all inspired to take exceptional care of our customers, providers and ourselves. We believe in integrity, accountability, collaboration, and giving every employee equitable opportunity for their voice to be heard and development to be fostered.

If you're excited about the prospect of transforming the future of health care and growing in your career, join our smile revolution!

To see some of the smiling faces behind Delta Dental and to learn more about what our values and culture look like in action, connect with us on social media: Delta Dental Ins. on Facebook and Instagram, #LifeatDDins on Facebook and Instagram , Delta Dental Ins. on Twitter and Delta Dental Ins. on LinkedIn .

We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation's largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.

Delta Dental is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace for all employees. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender or identity expression, age, disability, marital status, medical status, veteran status or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. In addition to federal law requirements, Delta Dental complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Unfortunately, our Delta Dental Enterprise is unable to hire individuals residing in Alaska, North Dakota, Nebraska, Hawaii, Oklahoma, Vermont, Maine, West Virginia, New Hampshire, Wyoming, Puerto Rico or other US Territories at this time.

Proof of eligibility to work in the United States must be provided if selected for hire.

Title: Software Developer - Python
Job_Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

This position is responsible for implementing, deploying, and supporting Production and Development Windows systems applications that provide services to our business and technical staff. Responsibilities include identifying and correcting performance issues, providing support to applications developers, infrastructure teams, DevOps and end-users. You will have the ability/experience in designing automated solutions, process improvement, Capacity and Performance Management, performance monitoring, software installations/upgrades, technical assistance, server security management, hardware recommendations and procurement. In depth working knowledge of Windows Operating Systems, storage, network, databases, DevOps tools, PowerShell scripting and programming are required.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Manages systems and applications based on the Windows Server System platform.
Performs day-to-day Windows application administration, performance monitoring, backup and recovery, triage support, troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and problem resolution.
Performs/assists in periodic and emergency system and patch maintenance while minimizing client impact to the greatest extent possible.
Researches, analyzes, and makes recommendations for hardware, software, network and system standards and configurations.
Performs performance analysis, troubleshooting for end user reported issues or reported slowness of application resources and present findings and / or recommendations to upper management.
Participates in project work and KTLO efforts with end user clients, operations, helpdesk, vendors, and other IT technical team members.
Coordinates work efforts with users, operations, helpdesk, vendors, and other technical team members for systems engineering installations and updates.
Prepares system documentation, operational/recovery guides, project plans and status reports for team and management as needed or required.
Provides training to other engineers in line with Systems Engineering Teams Best Practices.
Provides input in improving existing products and procedures and evaluating POCs including collaborating with IT technical teams and end users on IT strategies.

QUALIFICATIONS

Experience with Windows Server System products involving a variety of software and hardware implementations.
Experience with client support in multi-server and multi-environment.
Experience supporting multi-tier applications, as part of client server architecture.
Ability to demonstrate requirements analysis, design, implementation, and maintenance responsibilities for these systems as well as production support of multiple servers.
Experience within an environment of structured life cycle management including change management system and extensive testing prior to implementation.
Must be capable of working in all phases of Windows application deployment in supporting production and development environments, including the ability to troubleshoot, resolve, and recommend technology solutions related to Windows Server and networks.
Experience working as a member of a technical team and/or leading the roll out of production and development systems. This would include assisting in the development and implementation of Policies and Procedures for the production environment as well as overall systems documentation.
Excellent customer service skills required. Excellent business and technical communication skills, both verbal and written. Must read and write English fluently.
Excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills required. Ability to foster an environment that promotes long-term problem avoidance. This is the ability to determine problem sources and implement solutions/policies and procedures that reduce the possibility of problems reoccurring.
Demonstrated leadership in work quality and practices and in mentoring technical team members.
Ability to work proactively, independently, and quickly learn technical and/or conceptual information, identify key issues and details, and present understandable alternatives to both technical and non-technical individuals.
Ability to manage time and priorities with minimal guidance and to respond to multiple and competing deadlines. Ability to work on multiple tasks that are not necessarily well defined, under pressure of full workload, tight deadlines and shifting priorities.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

That includes serving up relevant technologies to the community through Stack Overflow Advertising, providing direct access to technology-specific subject matter experts with Collectives™, sharing more about companies as future employers, and helping teams scale with its market-leading knowledge sharing and collaboration platform, Stack Overflow for Teams.

You'll be a key part of our mission to empower every Stacker to use data to solve problems, identify insights, and do their best work.

We empower the best people to help sustain our world. 100% employee-owned. Independence guaranteed.

ACRT Services, Inc.
About The Team
ACRT Services offers expert independent consulting solutions to utilities and associated organizations throughout the United States, including vegetation management consulting, arborist training, customized safety courses, technology solutions, utility metering services, and more. Candidates should have strong experience in the mobile development space. They will be play an integral role to design, build, test, and support custom developed mobile applications. This role will help guide ACRT Services’ mobile architecture and strategy.

Title: Sr. Web Developer, Mobile
Job_Description:
Role Description As a Product Manager focused on Dropbox s Developer Infrastructure Team, you will play a critical role in defining the strategic and tactical vision and roadmap for all the build tooling (commercial, open source, and home grown) and various engineering systems within both the CI and CD domains.
You will be responsible for working across multiple teams to understand their technical and business needs and figuring out how to build and evolve our CI and CD build toolchain so that it offers the best in class experience for our development teams and deployment systems.
You will have a significant strategic impact and influence Dropbox s CICD strategy and will be uniquely positioned to empower hundreds of developers and improving the experience for millions of Dropbox users.
Responsibilities Own CI build tooling and workflows roadmap and strategy for all of Dropbox (web, server, mobile, desktop) Stay up to date on major developments within the build toolchain domain and bring relevant innovations (Web Assembly, TurboPack, Bazel Cloud, etc) to our service offerings.
Operationalize engineering systems and services such as Artifactory, Vault, SemGrep, Synk, Code Security Tools, and Container security tooling and incorporate them within templatized CICD workflows.
Work in lockstep with the Platform team to build tooling, automated processes, and systems to enable continuous delivery (CD).
Build containerized developer sandboxes and tooling around Kubernetes platform Showcase your team s build tooling capabilities to various engineering teams and understand your customer.
Make build tooling enablement a seamless and intuitive experience.
Be an expert at prioritization a deep partnership with engineering is key to ensure that we are appropriately balancing foundational efforts with new capabilities that reduce complexity and advance short term and long term goals.
Drive to results. Your expertise in navigating, unblocking and persisting through challenges that arise during execution will be important as you deliver on your roadmap: making trade-offs, anticipating staffing needs, risks, and ensuring frequent and clear communication to all of your internal and external stakeholders.
Requirements BS or MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Business, Applied Math or Statistics, or relevant experience.
4+ years of PM or Engineering Manager experience working within the CI domain and having in-depth experience with the build toolchain for some particular framework.
Solid understanding of containerization (Docker, Kubernetes, Containerd, Kaniko) domain.
Experience with Bazel highly desirable Keen eye for details and data driven decision making.
Proven ability to collaborate with engineering teams and cross-functional partners in a highly collaborative environment.
Be effective and communicate clearly and concisely with engineering and product leadership, and influence our technical strategy.
Build consensus and listen well, but can also drive hard decisions.
Ability to sell and influence without authority, and deal with ambiguity.
Total Rewards At Dropbox, we strive to be a great place for all Dropboxers to grow and be recognized for that growth.
This job posting reflects broad requirements, and represents two potential levels of role.
Through our assessment process, we will identify your level that ties to compensation based on your experience and technical expertise along with the scope of the role.
For candidates hired in Colorado, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $137,400 - $161,600 - $185,800 if you are assessed at the IC3 level.
If you are instead assessed at the IC4 level, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $153,000 - $180,000 - $207,000.
This salary/OTE range represents the low, middle, and high end of the salary or OTE (Sales roles) range for this position, and is subject to change.
To determine a Dropboxer s starting pay we carefully consider a variety of factors, including primary work location and an evaluation of a candidate s skills, experience, market demands, and internal parity.
This position may be considered a promotional opportunity.
Salary/OTE is just one component of Dropbox s total rewards package.
All regular employees are also eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).
Dropbox is committed to investing in the holistic health and wellbeing of all Dropboxers and their families.
Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to: Competitive medical, dental and vision coverage (US Only) Competitive 401(k) Plan with a generous company match and immediate vesting Flexible Time Off/Paid Time Off, paid holidays, 11 Company-wide PTO days, Volunteer time off and more Protection Plans including; Life Insurance, Disability Insurance and Travel benefit plans Perks Allowance to be used on what matters most to you, whether that s wellness, learning and development, food & groceries, and much more Parental benefits including; Parental Leave, Child and Adult Care, Day Care FSA (US Only), Fertility Benefits (US Only), Adoption and Surrogacy support and Lactation Support Mental Health and Wellness benefits Free Dropbox space for your friends and family Additional benefits details are available upon request.
Dropbox is in the process of updating our technology to provide pay ranges in New York City based on the recent amendments to the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL).
If you are based in NYC and have any questions about the pay range for this role, please contact paytransparency@ and provide your name and the job title to which you are interested in applying.

As they continue to evolve, their vision is to become the operating system for local commerce by providing an integrated suite of tools and services for local businesses to help them understand their customers better, compete effectively, and increase profits.

Title: Sr. Web Developer, Mobile

About TodayTix
TodayTix is leading the mobile revolution for theatrical ticketing, an industry that has not modernized in decades. Riding the wave of tremendous growth in mobile sales, TodayTix is the only mobile-based platform for Broadway ticketing, a $1B industry in New York City alone. Designed for the way modern users plan and manage their time, TodayTix is focused on last-minute sales, capitalizing on remaining ticket inventory to discount prices and fill seats.
After launching just a few months ago in December, TodayTix now has over 100,000 users and has transacted millions of dollars in sales along with garnering major press attention, including Associated Press, Huffington Post, Entertainment Weekly, Variety, Crain’s, and more. TodayTix is growing rapidly. We are on track to launch in London by the end of the year, with additional cities to be rolled out next year. Our team is growing, too. Join TodayTix and grow with us!

Firebrand Technologies is seeking remote candidates for a SQL Developer position. We are looking for a motivated, ambitious, and tenacious SQL guru to join the integrations team. For more than 30 years Firebrand Technologies has been specializing in getting new publishing clients' title data into our Title Management application, as well as building and supporting tools that help us do this as efficiently as possible. We are interested in a developer who understands the process of software development, including the importance of development, test, and production environments and responsibilities inherent in each. If you consider winding your way through several layers of code and hitting some land mines along the way a good time, then we want to work with you. We encourage creativity and ingenuity and hope you can teach us a few tricks of your own, when appropriate.
A general sense of pride and accountability in your work are necessary to become successful in this position, as is the desire to meet high quality standards. Our clients are very dear to us and we go above and beyond to make sure that their needs are met. Our small team has the luxury of working outside of strict engineering guidelines but needs to remain disciplined and conscious of the big picture. This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to the growth of Firebrand Technologies.

Title: Sr. Web Developer, Mobile
Job_Description:
About FAIR Health
FAIR Health, Inc., a national, independent nonprofit organization, was established in October 2009 with the mission to help assure fairness and transparency in health insurance information. FAIR Health has created a database of over 38 billion de-identified private healthcare claim records—the largest in the country—which receives claims monthly and which serves as the foundation for a variety of data products, custom analytics and consumer tools. FAIR Health has also been certified by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services as a “Qualified Entity” and thus holds the entire collection of Medicare Parts A, B and D claims from 2013 to the present, which get routinely refreshed.
Our standard data modules, custom analytics and technological tools serve all participants in the healthcare sector nationwide; they are licensed to payors, third-party administrators, bill review companies, self-insured employers, government agencies, academic researchers and consultants. Our medical and dental data are used to inform statutes and regulations, healthcare cost indices, fee schedules, benefit and provider network design, practice/facility expansion, health systems research and dispute resolution, among other uses. We also offer a suite of consumer-oriented tools and resources available on our consumer website (fairhealthconsumer.org), as well as a mobile application, which can be licensed by other organizations.

Title: Sr. Web Developer, Mobile
Job_Description:
Company Overview
Every great story has a new beginning. We're excited to announce that Discovery and WarnerMedia have combined to become Warner Bros. Discovery. WBD is a premier global media and entertainment company offering audiences the world’s most differentiated and complete portfolio of content, brands and franchises across television, film, sports, news, streaming and gaming. We’re home to the world’s best storytellers, creating world-class products for consumers. From brilliant creatives to technology trailblazers and beyond, join us as we step into the next chapter.
Our Story
We are CNN. THE WORLD'S MOST ESSENTIAL AND ENGAGING SOURCE OF DIGITAL NEWS. We are in the midst of rapid transformation and need you to help us find the next generation of innovators, makers, and dreamers who will lead and drive our growth. We aim to make the world a better, more connected place. Join us!
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles that will be performed in New York City. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $117,600.00 - $218,400.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

The Senior Software Engineer will be a part of the Group Billing Team and help modernize our Online Billing Application and Group Management Experience. Along with writing effective code, the position will be responsible for designing, building, delivering and maintaining a highly scalable set of products and applications. The incumbent will use industry best practices and work collaboratively with cross-functional team of product managers, UX designers, architects, principal engineers, software engineers, test automation team and DevOps engineers.

The Senior Software Engineer will be part of an engineering team that builds and supports amazing customer-facing products that will drive the next generation of Delta Dental Digital Experience.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Performs as a key contributor to an engineering team that builds and supports exceptional products that provide innovative solutions to challenging business use cases, existing system and operational problems.
Participates in architectural design, system analysis, and programming activities on application software; this may often require independent research and study.
Develops high-quality and production-ready software by using best-practice data structures, algorithms, design patterns, and frameworks that are maintainable, scalable, responsive, and secure.
Writes highest quality code with utmost attention to scalability, security and performance and with an end-to-end mindset from conception to delivery and production support, owning specifications, quality, release deployments and monitoring of production health.
Produces complete, simple, and readable technical documentation for everything developed and maintains a team culture of documenting everything.
Tests and ensures quality of all code that developed in line with principles of test-driven development and continuous delivery, utilizing test automation frameworks wherever possible.
Participates in code-reviews, provides technical guidance and mentors software engineers.
Collaborates closely with Engineering leadership, Product Managers, Designers, Test Automation and other teams and business units to define, prioritize, sequence and scope business and functional requirements and drive results.
Instruments infrastructure and application performance monitoring, capacity management, alerting, tools instrumentation and metrics (KPI) management.
Performs impact assessment of product (hardware, software) upgrades.
Assists in planning, coordinating, and executing engineering projects.
Supports and collaborates with other Engineers through evaluation, design analysis, and development phases.
Maintains knowledge, ensures competency and compliance with policies and procedures, in order to be the technical expert while collaborating with cross-functional teams.
This list is not all-inclusive and you are expected to perform other duties as requested or assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

4+ years experience with a Degree in Computer Science and/or equivalent technical education and experience.
Expertise with Java/J2EE experience including frameworks such as Spring MVC and Hibernate.
Experience with Spring Boot, microservices, NoSQL, caching and message queue technologies
Integration experience consuming REST Services.
Cloud experience with AWS or Azure or Google or PCF.
Ability to understand business plans and apply that information into the development of an IT business case.
Anticipates problems, resistance or likely objections and takes action to resolve them.
Ability to lead and manage small to large enterprise network implementations or changes.
Ability to guide, train and mentor associate engineers.
Highly skilled in developing quantitative cost/benefit analysis to measure improvements.
Proficient in organizational processes as well as capable of assessing and initiating change of such processes.
Demonstrates an in-depth knowledge and application of competency and can consult as well as lead others in its application.
Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills.
Knowledge of agile development methodologies.
Ability to develop and maintain key vendor relationships with a focus on technology currency and best practices.
Life-long learner, process improver.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Rewards to make you smile! We don't just want to make our customers happy - we want to give our employees a reason to smile, too. Delta Dental's comprehensive benefits package includes:

Generous paid time off plus 12 holidays and your birthday off!
Low-cost premium medical insurance options
100% paid dental and vision insurance
Generous 401(k) matching and flat contribution
Social responsibility and volunteer opportunities, including 16 paid volunteer hours annually
Employee LiveWell program, focusing on overall employee well-being
Fertility and diabetes benefits
AT&T/Verizon, entertainment, travel, and more!
career development and tuition reimbursement
we love promoting from within
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

#LI-Onsite

ABOUT THE TEAM

At Delta Dental, our success is only as strong as the people who execute it! We take enormous pride in being the nation's most recognized and widely-used provider of dental insurance - and we've come this far by living our core values of innovation, excellence, service and trust. Our vision is to motivate and empower every employee so that we're all inspired to take exceptional care of our customers, providers and ourselves. We believe in integrity, accountability, collaboration, and giving every employee equitable opportunity for their voice to be heard and development to be fostered.

If you're excited about the prospect of transforming the future of health care and growing in your career, join our smile revolution!

To see some of the smiling faces behind Delta Dental and to learn more about what our values and culture look like in action, connect with us on social media: Delta Dental Ins. on Facebook and Instagram, #LifeatDDins on Facebook and Instagram , Delta Dental Ins. on Twitter and Delta Dental Ins. on LinkedIn .

We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation's largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.

Delta Dental is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace for all employees. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender or identity expression, age, disability, marital status, medical status, veteran status or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. In addition to federal law requirements, Delta Dental complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Unfortunately, our Delta Dental Enterprise is unable to hire individuals residing in Alaska, North Dakota, Nebraska, Hawaii, Oklahoma, Vermont, Maine, West Virginia, New Hampshire, Wyoming, Puerto Rico or other US Territories at this time.

Proof of eligibility to work in the United States must be provided if selected for hire.

Delta Dental* has enacted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to protect all employees and the communities we serve due to the ongoing impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. Accordingly, we require all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Are you able to comply with our policy of being fully vaccinated by your start date if an offer is made or have a medical or sincerely held religious exemption for receiving a COVID-19 vaccine? Failure to comply with our policy and submit proof of compliance or receive approval for a valid medical or sincerely held religious belief exemption prior to your start date will nullify any offer of employment extended to you.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
Role Description Dropbox is seeking an exceptional Technical Program Manager to manage multiple programs and projects for the Strategic Programs and Initiatives Team.
This is a new, challenging, and highly visible position.
SPI TPMs are responsible for much of the heavy lifting on projects to ensure that our large scale projects are run efficiently and effectively.
Responsibilities You will be responsible for identifying stakeholders, driving to set roadmaps and strategies for the program, driving delivery, reporting status, and holding the bar on product quality.
At Dropbox, TPMs handle complex inter-team dependencies and bridge the gaps in technical management.
You will need to work with many different domain resources from Product Managers, Engineers, Engineering Managers, UX Designers, Product Marketing, User Researchers, Product Analysts, Growth, Legal, etc.
Successful candidates will have a strong technical background, be detail driven and have excellent problem-solving abilities.
You will have a deep understanding of product design and implementation details and will successfully represent the technical team to senior leadership and customers.
Your technical acumen and operational excellence will influence the team decisions and drive secure and robust solutions which have great customer experience.
Requirements 5+ years of Technical Program Management experience in a related industry Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent years of work experience running technical programs Exceptional written and verbal communication, and comfortable presenting in large groups and handling high-pressure communication with senior management Experience with managing large cross-functional projects with technical depth Must have a thorough understanding of software development lifecycle from concept to delivery Proven track record for being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow-through on projects Total Rewards At Dropbox, we strive to be a great place for all Dropboxers to grow and be recognized for that growth.
This job posting reflects broad requirements, and represents two potential levels of role.
Through our assessment process, we will identify your level that ties to compensation based on your experience and technical expertise along with the scope of the role.
Our Engineering Career Framework is viewable by anyone outside the company and describes what s expected for our engineers at each of our career levels.
Check out our blog post on this topic and more here.
For candidates hired in Colorado, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $110,200 - $129,600 - $149,000 if you are assessed at the IC3 level.
If you are instead assessed at the IC4 level, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $129,900 - $152,800 - $175,700.
This salary/OTE range represents the low, middle, and high end of the salary or OTE (Sales roles) range for this position, and is subject to change.
To determine a Dropboxer s starting pay we carefully consider a variety of factors, including primary work location and an evaluation of a candidate s skills, experience, market demands, and internal parity.
This position may be considered a promotional opportunity.
Salary/OTE is just one component of Dropbox s total rewards package.
All regular employees are also eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).
Dropbox is committed to investing in the holistic health and wellbeing of all Dropboxers and their families.
Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to: Competitive medical, dental and vision coverage (US Only) Competitive 401(k) Plan with a generous company match and immediate vesting Flexible Time Off/Paid Time Off, paid holidays, 11 Company-wide PTO days, Volunteer time off and more Protection Plans including; Life Insurance, Disability Insurance and Travel benefit plans Perks Allowance to be used on what matters most to you, whether that s wellness, learning and development, food & groceries, and much more Parental benefits including; Parental Leave, Child and Adult Care, Day Care FSA (US Only), Fertility Benefits (US Only), Adoption and Surrogacy support and Lactation Support Mental Health and Wellness benefits Free Dropbox space for your friends and family Additional benefits details are available upon request.
Dropbox is in the process of updating our technology to provide pay ranges in New York City based on the recent amendments to the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL).
If you are based in NYC and have any questions about the pay range for this role, please contact paytransparency@ and provide your name and the job title to which you are interested in applying.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
About Us
Twitch is the world's biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It's where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment.
We're about community, inside and out. You'll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We're on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we're up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we're solving on our Blog.
About the Role
Twitch's community of broadcasters and viewers are at the heart of everything we build. As a User Experience Designer at Twitch, you will produce high-quality visual experiences which bring joy to people all over the world. Your ability to summarize design system needs into functional, beautiful solutions will be paramount for achieving success.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
You Have: • 2+ years experience as a UX designer, product designer, or interaction designer • An aesthetic sense and the ability to design a flexible and cohesive solution across many points of input • Empathy for those you work with who will use the design system day in and day out
Job summary About Us: Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on Linkedin, Twitter and on our Blog. About the Position: Twitch's community of broadcasters and viewers are at the heart of everything we build. As a User Experience Designer at Twitch, you will produce high-quality visual experiences which bring joy to people all over the world. Your ability to summarize design system needs into functional, beautiful solutions will be paramount for achieving success. The Core UI Design System team at Twitch empowers our Designers and Engineers alike with consistent, accessible and aesthetic building blocks that bring their products to life. As part of this team, you will bring your touch to every product on Twitch as the backbone of the UI on our platform. We're looking for a gifted designer to establish new design patterns while building upon existing ones. We offer a series of stimulating problems, an environment that's exciting, motivating, fun, and new. The Core UI team presents the unique opportunity to work directly with your users every day and respond to their needs in real time. If you are an advocate for designing for humans and create playful and caring software for your customers, you will flourish on this team. This position can be located in Seattle, WA; San Francisco, CA; New York, NY; and Salt Lake City, UT or Remote US You Will: • Collaborate with engineers and designers across the company • Take full ownership of your designs from start to finish, including collaboration with partner teams, mockups, integration into the design library, documentation and hand off to engineering • Participate in the planning and ideation process for new components and patterns • Design UI components by using feedback, data, and an understanding of accessibility guidelines

Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.
From your first day at Roku, you’ll make a valuable — and valued — contribution. We’re a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
WHO WE ARE:
ActBlue is a nonprofit that builds tech and infrastructure for Democratic campaigns, progressive-aligned causes, and people trying to make an impact in order to fuel long-term, people-powered change. If you've ever given online to a Democrat or progressive organization, chances are you've used our powerful online fundraising platform.
We put power in the hands of small-dollar donors and help thousands of groups — from presidential candidates to environmental organizations — build grassroots movements. We envision a democracy where everyone looking to make progressive people-powered change can easily and effectively deploy their resources, energy, and creativity to shape our country and futures. Each and every one of us, from the political activists to the tech innovators to the customer service pros, is fully committed to our mission.
THE OPPORTUNITY:
ActBlue Technical Services' (ATS) product organization is made up of 80+ people (and growing!). We're organized into cross-functional teams that operate independently in alignment with ActBlue's broader organizational goals.
In this role, you will be responsible for understanding user needs, exploring ideas and direction, and designing end-to-end user experiences. You will work on end-to-end projects with agency and in concert with our UX Research, Product, Engineering, Marketing, Customer Service, and Outreach teams.
Your manager will be your coach, supporting your professional growth while you contribute to the excellence and advancement of our platform.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
Job Posting End Date: November 18
Unum is a company of people serving people. As one of the world's leading employee benefits providers and a Fortune 500 company, Unum's financial protection benefits help protect more than 36 million working people and their families from the financial impact of illness or injury. Unum's two distinct, but similarly focused US businesses – Unum US and Colonial Life – are each a market leader in making disability, life, accident, critical illness, dental, and vision insurance accessible in the workplace. Headquartered in Chattanooga, Tennessee, Unum also has significant US operations in Portland, Maine and Baton Rouge, Louisiana - and over 35 field offices nationwide. Colonial Life is headquartered in Columbia, South Carolina with over 40 field offices nationwide.
General Summary:
Leave Logic is a cloud-based Software as a Service (SaaS) technology platform that makes leave of absence planning easier for employees and employers. We are a wholly-owned subsidiary of Unum Group and enjoy all the benefits of operating as a fast-moving small business coupled with the backing of a Fortune 500 company. Leave Logic is one of several products within Unum’s Digital Solutions portfolio.

An Agile leader, the Senior “Sr.” Product Owner collaborates closely with IT and business stakeholders to drive capability development of complex transformational efforts, focused on the Unum Leave Logic solution, in support of excellent customer and user experience. The Sr. Product Owner manages the scrum team delivery of supporting capabilities needed for execution of the Leave Logic roadmap, driving feature definition and keeping the teams focused on delivering what matters most. The Sr. Product Owner is also accountable for operational readiness and mobilizes the right people to prepare the business to effectively accept, use and support new capabilities before they are delivered to production. The Sr. Product Owner may provide coaching and direction to others, if needed, based on the scope and complexity of their assigned roadmap.

Click on the link to learn more about Unum Leave Logic: https://vimeo.com/463633862

Unum

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
About Grio
Founded in 2008, Grio prides itself in being a premier full-service web and mobile software consulting agency based in San Francisco, CA. So, why join Grio? As a remote-work first company, Grio is committed to hiring teams with diverse backgrounds for the purpose of promoting creativity, and believes great ideas come from teams with various perspectives. This means you get to work with team members located across the globe – from Mexico City to New York and everything in between.
Our employees boast about the positive collaboration they experience with their teammates and the company’s commitment to work/life flexibility. This speaks volumes to Grio’s year over year growth , repeat clients, and even repeat employees! We take an empathic approach to ensure that we’re delivering the best possible products to our clients, and use that same lens to create a culture of engagement for our employees.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
Principal, UI/UX Digital Designer – San Francisco, California OR Denver, Colorado OR Austin, Texas OR New York, New York
Are you excited about working for a Global Fintech Company? Are you well versed in UI/UX design? Come join Western Union as a Principal, UI/UX Digital Designer!
Motivated by our values: purpose driven, globally minded, and trustworthy & respectful
We’re a FinTech that’s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. We’re a team of over 8,000 employees serving 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves, better things happen.
Better is enabled by trust and respect
In this role you will be a highly motivated UX Leader / Principal UX Digital Designer who is excited to join us to create the vision for the next gen of Western Union money transfer experience and then follow through with the processes and tactics to implement the vision. In this role you’ll serve as the guiding force for design that will delight and inspire our customers, drive vision and execution across ongoing releases for WU product experiences.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
At Hiro, we’re making it easier for developers to build the next generation of smart contracts and decentralized apps. We build developer tools for Stacks, an open-source network which makes Bitcoin programmable. With Hiro, developers can test and deploy smart contracts, spin up nodes and other server-side resources for scaling, and get access to monitoring and analytics. Our solutions provide developers with the convenience and reliability they need to be successful.

We’re very proud to say that Hiro won 3 Built In’s Best places to work awards! We received Best Places to Work NYC, Best Places to Work Small Companies, and Best Paying Companies NYC!

Hiro is funded and backed by more than $75 million from Union Square Ventures, Y Combinator, Lux Capital, Winklevoss Capital, Naval Ravikant, and others.

About the Opportunity

We’re looking for a Sr. Product Designer to join our remote-first team here at Hiro and help us design user-facing products such as the Stacks Explorer. This role will be critical in ensuring that users and developers alike can access and scale usage of applications built with the Stacks blockchain. The ideal candidate has a background working on consumer app experiences in either the crypto industry or for a developer-focused company. You’ll be responsible for leading the design efforts for the Platform team at Hiro as well as contributing to design efforts across the company.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
Cadent powers the evolution of TV brand advertising. We provide marketers, agencies, operators, and media owners with data-driven solutions for buying and selling TV advertising. By connecting brands with opportunities across national inventory sources—cable, broadcast, and digital media—our technology improves efficiencies and boosts the results of linear, addressable, and cross-screen campaigns.
In the advertising world, the one with the best platform to target customers, and analytics to understand them, wins. Through our forward-looking solutions, we are defining the present and future (programmatic, addressable, advanced TV) of broadcast/cable audience technology, data, analytics and automation.
With offices in New York, Philadelphia, and San Jose, Cadent is a team of talented engineers, designers, product folk, and the like, constructing a rich set of tools that help our company and customers anticipate the needs of the $200B+ TV advertising market.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
Why Kyndryl
Our world has never been more alive with opportunities and, at Kyndryl, we’re ready to seize them. We design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. Kyndryl is at the heart of progress — dedicated to helping companies and people grow strong. Our people are actively discovering, co-creating, and strengthening. We push ourselves and each other to seek better, to go further, and we carry this energy to our customers. At Kyndryl, we want you to keep growing, and we’ll provide plenty of opportunities to make that happen.

This position will consider candidates willing to relocate to Austin, TX, OR will be residing in Eastern or Central US time zones.

If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the compensation range for the position, $50,000 - $98,000, is based on a full-time schedule. If you're hired into New York City work location the compensation range for the position, $55,000 - $108,000. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
About Us
We are a San Francisco based company founded in 2003. Our mission is simple: we help people. We have democratized professional services by connecting customers with verified and vetted Experts who provide reliable answers at any hour and on any budget. JustAnswer members enjoy round-the-clock access to 12,000+ doctors, lawyers, tech support, mechanics, vets, home repair pros, and more. In the last 15 years, we have helped 10 million customers in 196 countries by answering more than 16 million questions. Our investors are Charles Schwab, Crosslink Capital, and Glynn Capital Management.
About the Role
Come join JustAnswer's growing UX team to create engaging experiences for our consumers across desktop, mobile, and app platforms. As part of UX, you will be a thought leader and help drive innovation across all experiences for JustAnswer. This position requires a proven track record of working within product design teams and experience designing innovative digital consumer products from inception to launch. Marketing experience a plus.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
About us

Mavenoid is the world’s first hardware support platform. We’ve built a virtual assistant and other tools that help customers set up, use, and troubleshoot everything from dishwashers and printers to robotic lawnmowers and electric scooters. With iconic brands like HP and Jabra as clients and $40 million in funding from top VC firms like Creandum and Point Nine Capital, we’re reinventing technical support for physical products. Having recently raised our Series B, we’re entering an exciting phase of growth but are still small enough for each new person to have a big impact on the company as a whole. As an international virtual-first company, we have office optional culture with Mavens located all over North America and Europe.

The role

You will work on all things frontend, from technical implementation to information architecture to visual design to helping us grow the team. You will start hands-on, hacking on our TypeScript codebase to improve UX and add features, but before long we expect you to be contributing on a more long term level with an idea on how you see our product grow and mature.

About EIQ
Helping injured workers get back to work!
EvolutionIQ’s mission is to harness the power of AI to transform the insurance industry, maximizing the best outcomes for both insurance carriers and claimants. The $1.3 trillion insurance industry has some of the world’s largest, most complex datasets that have not yet had artificial intelligence applied to it at scale. We have brought together world-class technical talent to create an entirely new product which is revolutionizing the industry and improving lives.
About You

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
Who are we?
Awarded for six consecutive years as one of Crain's 100 Best Places to Work in New York City, LiveAuctioneers is the leading online marketplace for one-of-a-kind items, rare collectibles and coveted goods. Our ever-changing online catalogues have included everything from Banksy prints and first-edition Harry Potter books to Garth Brooks' tour bus and rare Hermès Birkin bags. Last year, LiveAuctioneers processed $7.4 billion in bids, connecting millions of the world's most knowledgeable collectors with 7,000+ vetted, professional sellers of extraordinary, previously owned items.
Founded in 2002, LiveAuctioneers is a technology innovator in resale marketplaces and was the first to introduce mobile bidding, video-streamed auctions, ratings and reviews, and more, to the online-auction industry. In its continuing role as a pioneer in the buying and selling of exceptional items, LiveAuctioneers is now developing FinTech and SaaS solutions that empower small auction business owners to be influencers in the “passion economy” and build a loyal following. You have an opportunity to join a company led by a management team who had a hand in taking market-leading companies like Google, Seamless, GrubHub and 1stdibs from niche websites to household names.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
Senior Digital Product Designer
Location: New York or Hybrid Remote
We have offices in New York and London and this role can be based in either office or hybrid remote (subject to your legal right to work within either jurisdiction). Our offices often have collaboration days and our preference is that you are within commutable distance to one of our offices.
About OpenFin
OpenFin is a fast-growing financial technology company backed by the world's largest banks and most respected Fintech VCs, including J.P. Morgan, Barclays, HSBC, Wells Fargo, SC Ventures, Bain Capital Ventures, DRW, Nyca Partners, and Pivot Investment Partners. OpenFin modernizes and democratizes app development and distribution in the finance space. We provide a secure OS that brings a fast and intuitive app experience to the financial desktop. Built on Google's Chromium and GitHub's Electron open source projects, OpenFin combines native experience, data sharing, lightning-fast distribution, and robust security with an agile web development and deployment model to accelerate digital transformation and innovation. OpenFin is used by thousands of developers to deploy and run more than 3500 apps at more than 2400 financial institutions.

Title: User Experience (UI/UX) Senior Manager
Job_Description:
SageSure is seeking a senior, strategically oriented designer to lead human-centered design on our Claims team. You'll work closely with Design leadership and contribute to our lively design culture while collaborating with your product and engineering teammates to deliver rich and intelligent solutions to unique problems. If you're excited about being at the forefront of innovation in the insurance industry and bringing to life an essential part of SageSure’s mission, this is the role for you.

About you:
You’re an accomplished product designer with meaningful experience in insurtech, fintech, or complex business workflows with great user experience. You’re comfortable collaboratively leading UX research, ideation, and UI design and have a passion for shipping software that meaningfully impacts the business and its customers. You design holistic solutions for new features and integrate with existing products while being an evangelist for the design process throughout the organization. As Senior Designer, you'll work directly with product managers and engineering through the entire software development life cycle. You'll uncover problems and test solutions, using strategic, modern design patterns and paradigms in order to help people protect their most important assets.

Summary
Vertical Relevance is looking for an AWS App Modernization Consultant - full-time position, to join our team as a full-time employee in our New York or New Jersey office or work remotely. This person is responsible for the end-to-end planning, building, and deploying of software systems. He/she will be able to drive the programming of well-constructed, testable code.
As an AWS App Modernization Consultant, you will implement technical solutions as part of a team for customer engagements. This role requires strong teamwork, communication, patience and organization skills needed to drive customer success.
At Vertical Relevance we deliver with excellence through teamwork, automating everything, constantly learning and taking ownership for the outcomes our customers experience. Are you ready to join the team?

We empower the best people to help sustain our world. 100% employee-owned. Independence guaranteed.

ACRT Services, Inc.
About The Team
ACRT Services offers expert independent consulting solutions to utilities and associated organizations throughout the United States, including vegetation management consulting, arborist training, customized safety courses, technology solutions, utility metering services, and more. At ACRT Services, our organizational culture is built on four strategic pillars including the people and the amazing things they can accomplish, dedication and the success it brings over the long term, process and the benefits of a job done right and education and the difference it can mean in the lives of those we touch.
About the Role
The Sr. Web Developer, Mobile will design, build, test, and support custom developed websites and APIs to accompany software systems developed by ACRT Services. This role will develop custom solutions and web projects for employees and customers and will be responsible for taking the project from the planning stages through implementation and support. The candidate will work with IT and personnel in business units to identify needs and help stakeholders envision how our products can be deployed and used. This position will work closely with other internal and external developers to maintain the portfolio of systems as well as new IT projects and initiatives.
Candidates should have strong experience in the mobile development space. They will be play an integral role to design, build, test, and support custom developed mobile applications. This role will help guide ACRT Services’ mobile architecture and strategy.

About TodayTix
TodayTix is leading the mobile revolution for theatrical ticketing, an industry that has not modernized in decades. Riding the wave of tremendous growth in mobile sales, TodayTix is the only mobile-based platform for Broadway ticketing, a $1B industry in New York City alone. Designed for the way modern users plan and manage their time, TodayTix is focused on last-minute sales, capitalizing on remaining ticket inventory to discount prices and fill seats.
After launching just a few months ago in December, TodayTix now has over 100,000 users and has transacted millions of dollars in sales along with garnering major press attention, including Associated Press, Huffington Post, Entertainment Weekly, Variety, Crain’s, and more. TodayTix is growing rapidly. We are on track to launch in London by the end of the year, with additional cities to be rolled out next year. Our team is growing, too. Join TodayTix and grow with us!

Company Overview
Every great story has a new beginning. We're excited to announce that Discovery and WarnerMedia have combined to become Warner Bros. Discovery. WBD is a premier global media and entertainment company offering audiences the world’s most differentiated and complete portfolio of content, brands and franchises across television, film, sports, news, streaming and gaming. We’re home to the world’s best storytellers, creating world-class products for consumers. From brilliant creatives to technology trailblazers and beyond, join us as we step into the next chapter.
We build machine learning powered recommendation, search, and classification tools used across CNN’s platforms and experience. This year we have already launched two new products- “Watch Next”, a video recommendation experience in iOS, and “Related Articles”, recommending articles in article views in our iOS app and mobile web.

Wonolo (Work Now Locally) is disrupting the $140BN temporary staffing industry. Founded in 2014, Wonolo's mission is to help people find consistent work. Through our two-sided tech marketplace, we connect hundreds of businesses in need of front-line workers with over 1 million underemployed workers in local markets across the United States, within minutes. Wonolo empowers the in-demand workforce by democratizing access to flexible work, opportunities to learn new skills, a living wage, and comprehensive portable benefits and perks.

We're looking for a Senior iOS Software Engineer to join our Wonoloer team and help take our mobile app to the next level and make Wonolo indisputably the best experience in the category through high-quality mobile user experiences. January AI:
Founded by veteran business executive, Noosheen Hashemi, and Director of Genomics and Personalized Medicine at Stanford University, Dr. Michael Snyder, January AI is the first “precision health” company that combines continuous glucose monitoring along with heart rate, sleep, activity and food tracking, to enable you to see the impact of your diet and exercise on your body in real-time.

We help you understand your personal metabolic health, i.e. how your body metabolizes food, and make simple changes to avoid serious health issues down the road. The need for this has never been greater: 1 in 3 adults in the US are now pre-diabetic, and 80% are not even aware of it. January’s app and continuous glucose monitor gives you immediate insights on your diet and blood sugar levels, and provides personalized recommendations on how to adjust your diet and activity to improve your overall metabolic wellbeing. We help you build better habits in just 30 days.

Title: IT Manager
Job_Description:
Role Description Dropbox is looking for a senior leader to drive the creation of a new telco distribution channel for Dropbox, end-to-end.
We believe there's a $100M+ opportunity in having Dropbox services resold, bundled, and/or otherwise distributed via telcos.
We want you to develop the strategy, pitch it to leading telcos, stand the initial partnerships up, and prove out this hypothesis, so we can make the appropriate investments to grow it to become the nine-figure opportunity it deserves to be.
You should know the space really well, have a rolodex of contacts you can call on, and most importantly, have the 0-to-1 mentality and drive to make something happen where it didn't already exist.
You've got to have strategic vision and then the gusto, salesperson-ship, persistence, and grit to make it a reality.
We're looking for someone who knows how to make magic happen.
We already have most of the distribution APIs you'd need to do this.
You'll also already have a senior-level operations manager to help you stand the initial partnerships up, and we've got a product suite that should be very attractive to telcos.
Specifically, while you likely only think of Dropbox as File, Sync, and Share (FSS), we have expanded into a robust suite of tools that are extremely attractive to our large consumer, prosumer, and SMB customer base, including: e-Signature, Backup and Restore, Password Management, Screen Recording, Large File Delivery, Universal Search, and so much more!
We provide a very competitive comp and benefits package and are a virtual-first company, meaning you get to work from anywhere.
If you can deliver on the above objectives, we can compensate you well and provide an excellent lifestyle.
Responsibilities Develop an overall guiding strategy for this channel Identify high-impact, seven-figure+ revenue-driving partnerships with global Telco companies.
You will be held accountable for closing deals within a reasonable timeframe that drive an appropriate amount of revenue, i.e.
your performance will be judged on impact not activity Hustle to creatively pitch partners on the 1+1=3 opportunity and drive home the Dropbox value proposition Engage with senior executive-level contacts with key partners and leverage C-level support to drive success Formulate innovative deal terms that acquire, engage, and monetize customers at scale, while reinforcing Dropbox s position as a market leader Propose partner product integrations within workflows to improve product utility, and effectively engage users with the Dropbox value proposition Lead contract negotiations with partners, finding creative solutions to complex problems while maximizing strategic and revenue benefits Work effectively internally across product, engineering, finance, legal, marketing, and other key stakeholders to build support for projects, while balancing internal dependencies necessary for execution Requirements 10+ years of experience in Telco business development driving user and revenue growth via partnerships (previously growing a Telco vertical from 0 1 with global Telcos/Carriers is a big plus) Ability to set clear strategic direction and then execute against that vision Executive presence with exceptional presentation and communication skills; the ability to distill complex issues into structured frameworks and concrete plans Highly analytical with the ability to consume, process and transform large data sets into actionable insights Experience working with complex financial models, understanding the various inputs that influence ROI and incorporating those insights into deal planning Familiarity with a variety of deal structures and ability to review and analyze complex contracts; creative deal making abilities Strong organizational, time management, and prioritization skills with great attention to detail; flexibility to accommodate global partners in different time zones Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, comfort with ambiguity, and excellent interpersonal skills with an entrepreneurial spirit and sense of humor Masters in Business Administration (MBA) - Consulting background strongly preferred Total Rewards For candidates hired in Colorado, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $191,900 - $225,800 - $259,700.
This salary/OTE range represents the low, middle, and high end of the salary or OTE (Sales roles) range for this position, and is subject to change.
To determine a Dropboxer s starting pay we carefully consider a variety of factors, including primary work location and an evaluation of a candidate s skills, experience, market demands, and internal parity.
This position may be considered a promotional opportunity.
Salary/OTE is just one component of Dropbox s total rewards package.
All regular employees are also eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).
Dropbox is committed to investing in the holistic health and wellbeing of all Dropboxers and their families.
Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to: Competitive medical, dental and vision coverage (US Only) Competitive 401(k) Plan with a generous company match and immediate vesting Flexible Time Off/Paid Time Off, paid holidays, 11 Company-wide PTO days, Volunteer time off and more Protection Plans including; Life Insurance, Disability Insurance and Travel benefit plans Perks Allowance to be used on what matters most to you, whether that s wellness, learning and development, food & groceries, and much more Parental benefits including; Parental Leave, Child and Adult Care, Day Care FSA (US Only), Fertility Benefits (US Only), Adoption and Surrogacy support and Lactation Support Mental Health and Wellness benefits Free Dropbox space for your friends and family Additional benefits details are available upon request.
Dropbox is in the process of updating our technology to provide pay ranges in New York City based on the recent amendments to the New York City Human Rights Law (NYCHRL).
If you are based in NYC and have any questions about the pay range for this role, please contact paytransparency@ and provide your name and the job title to which you are interested in applying.

Title: IT Manager
Job_Description:

Collaboratively and independently develop and execute research projects.

Title: IT Manager
Job_Description:
IT Infrastructure Project proposal [Pre-Sales Phase]
1.Provide pre-sales support to Sales and Sales Engineers during the project proposal phase. Examples of fields that may require intervention are as follows:
a.Performing cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for the proposed project from the infrastructure perspective to support Sales/Sales Engineer teams.
b.Working with potential project members to define business requirements, goals and methods to resolve potential challenges.
c.Working with vendors to confirm capabilities and budgetary costs.
d.Defining potential tasks/risks of the project and roles of project members.
IT Infrastructure Project Execution [Post-Sales Phase]
2.Manage related vendors for each phase of project planning, design, and initiation for build-out and relocation projects that involve implementation of IT infrastructure including but not limited to network racks, cabling, AV equipment, security devices, wireless access points.
3.Create documentation such as the RFP, SOW, WBS, Action item list , Organization chart, and meeting minutes as necessary to keep track of the project.
4.Manage the project schedule to meet the customer’s desired installation date and oversee its organization, budgeting, and implementation.
5.Communicate with the customer frequently to align the understanding of project requirements and expectations amongst the involved parties.
6.Participate in meetings to track and share status updates with project members.
7.Oversee project execution, ensuring on-time, on-budget completion of projects that meet or exceed clients’ needs and expectations.
8.Ensure internal coordination with the teams working other aspects of the project which may have direct or indirect relationship with the IT infrastructure portion.

Title: IT Manager
Job_Description:
Introduction
Ranked by Forbes as one of the world’s best employers in 2021, IBM promotes growth and innovation to lead as we enter the era of hybrid cloud and AI – helping clients transform their business.

As a Designer, you will work with a technical pre-sales agile team to co-develop innovative business solutions with our clients. You will be directly impacting the world’s most influential enterprises and brands on the adoption of next-generation platforms.

IBM’s comprehensive onboarding program and industry-leading learning culture will prepare you with a strong foundation for client success. Our sales environment is collaborative and experiential. You'll be surrounded by bright minds and keen co-creators ready to assist as you apply practices that will compel our clients to invest in IBM's products and services.


In this role, your primary focus will be facilitating interactive workshops with clients. We have a set of standard approaches, but every engagement is customized. When your Client Engineering team is asked to work on a client project, you will participate in determining the right fit between the client, IBM and best approach for workshop.

A Designer in this position incorporates three roles: Facilitator, Consultant, and Designer:
Following a workshop, you may create designs for a Proof of Concept, a demo, or a Minimum Viable Product (MVP). You may also be engaged in information architecture, research, and/or evaluation.

For this position, the design work is concepts and processes – uncovering business value, defining a problem, shaping solutions, and proving them out. What you’re creating will look less like a visual designer’s portfolio and more like a user researcher’s portfolio.

Opportunities are available in: Atlanta GA, Boston MA, Chicago IL, Dallas TX, New York NY, San Francisco CA, and Washington DC – to name a few.

If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $73,000 to $152,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

Title: IT Manager
Job_Description:
Uplift’s mission is to help people get more out of life, one thoughtful purchase at a time. Our enterprise Buy Now, Pay Later solution is used by the world’s most loved brands including Southwest Airlines, Carnival Cruise Line, Universal Studios, and more. With flexible pay over time installments, we empower consumers to buy what matters most while unlocking higher conversions and customer lifetime value for our partners.
Our team is rapidly growing and comes from diverse backgrounds of leading technology and financial brands. Our HQ is in Sunnyvale, CA with offices in Toronto, New York, Reno, and Guadalajara, Mexico.
Working at Uplift allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Title: IT Manager
