Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote
Job_Description:
Dreaming big is in our DNA. Brewing the world’s most loved beers and creating meaningful experiences is what inspires us. We are owners, empowered to lead real change, deliver on tough challenges, and take accountability for the results. We are looking for talent that shares these values, that is ambitious, bold & resilient. We want talent that is looking for fast career growth, cross-functional experiences, global exposure and robust training & development.
Work Location: St. Louis, MO - New York City, NY - Denver, CO - Austin, TX - Miami, FL
Salary: $98,000 - $152,000 (pending location)
COMPANY:
Michelob ULTRA. Cutwater Spirits. Budweiser. Kona Brewing Co. Stella Artois. Bud Light. That’s right, over 100 of America’s most loved brands, to be exact. But there’s so much more to us than our top-notch portfolio of beers, seltzers, and more. We are powered by a 19,000-strong team that shares our passion to create a future with more cheers. We look for people with talent, curiosity, and commitment and provide the teammates, resources and opportunities to unleash their full potential. The power we create together – when we combine your strengths with ours – is unstoppable. Are you ready to join a team that dreams as big as you do?
ROLE SUMMARY:
The Team
“TechOps” is a team that is well rooted with the business and the functions inside Anheuser-Busch and covers both United States and Canada as a North American Zone (NAZ). In TechOps, you will design, build, test, and support software products that continue to be a competitive advantage to our business. You will act as a technical Subject Matter Expert (SME), and partner with others to deliver sustainable solutions and successful end-user experiences.
The Job
As a Software Engineer specializing in front end development with React, you will be key to unlocking business process efficiencies and bringing data to life through responsive, intuitive user experiences in business critical applications. You will work on a DevOps software engineering team dedicated to building enterprise applications with the latest and greatest cloud-first technology to enable key parts of our business. From contributing to new applications to enhancing existing products, you will work amongst a team of passionate software engineers, facilitated by a scrum master, with work prioritized by product owners.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote
Job_Description:
Role Description Our Engineering team is working to proactively build solutions that detect abusive behavior and trigger mitigations across Dropbox s products and capabilities.
Additionally, we build capabilities to reduce human decision-making in abuse investigations.
We follow a systematic and iterative process: we use data to decide what to build, learn from it, and adjust to prevent and dissuade external actors from using Dropbox to harm customers and the rest of the world.
Responsibilities You will make data driven decisions to decide what to build and prioritize You will own projects end to end, starting with data discovery, design, implementation, and deployment You will continuously seek ways to make a substantial impact and build backbone by delivering on time You will proactively address technical debt; you will operate your systems in production You will architect important systems and anticipate strategic and scaling-related challenges via thoughtful long-term planning You will own relationships with other engineering teams and collaborate with other functions within Dropbox Requirements BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding (e.g., physics or mathematics), or equivalent technical experience 5+ years of software engineering and/or work related industry experience Strong knowledge of shipping impactful and complex software projects Total Rewards Our Engineering Career Framework is viewable by anyone outside the company and describes what s expected for our engineers at each of our career levels.
Check out our blog post on this topic and more here.

This salary/OTE range represents the low, middle, and high end of the salary or OTE (Sales roles) range for this position, and is subject to change.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote
Job_Description:
HireArt is helping the world’s largest social network hire a UX Researcher (New Products) to partner directly with a single, tightly integrated pod with significant freedom to operate and the time, people, and space necessary for conceiving, building, and launching brand new products.

In this role, research is paramount to identify the right latent needs/problems to tackle with product solutions, iterative design research is needed to mold early product ideas into testable prototypes, and creative evaluative research is needed to improve and prepare those products for market.

As a UX Researcher (New Products), you’ll:
Collaborate closely with researchers, designers, project managers, and engineers to identify, define, and deliver meaningful products.
Collaboratively and independently develop and execute research projects.

This is a full-time, 12-month contract position staffed via HireArt. It will be fully remote and available to candidates local to the New York, NY; Los Angeles, CA; San Diego, CA; Denver, CO and Houston, TX areas.

HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas or employ corp-to-corp.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote
Job_Description:
Smarter Grid Solutions is a pioneering software technology company working at the intersection of clean energy, advanced digital technology, and power systems. We are a team of electrical engineers, software developers, analytics & consulting experts and much more working on the transformation of tomorrow’s electric grid – to become cleaner, more efficient, and more sustainable.
We supply unique products and services to electricity transmission and distribution network operators in the UK, Europe and North America. These services are centered on the Active Network Management (ANM) of distributed energy resources across transmission and distribution networks.
We are seeking a Graduate Smart Grid Engineer to join our growing Integration team to help us in our mission to transform todays energy systems!

Every great story has a new beginning. We're excited to announce that Discovery and WarnerMedia have combined to become Warner Bros. Discovery. We’re home to the world’s best storytellers, creating world-class products for consumers. From brilliant creatives to technology trailblazers and beyond, join us as we step into the next chapter.

We are continuously leveraging new technology to build immersive and interactive viewing experiences. Our platform covers everything from search, catalog, and video transcoding, to personalization, global subscriptions, and more. Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote
Job_Description:
Protect Democracy seeks a highly motivated Frontend Engineer to join the VoteShield team.

Protect Democracy was formed in late 2016 with an urgent and explicit mission: to prevent American democracy from declining into a more authoritarian form of government. We are a cross-partisan team that defend our institutions and work to make real the full promise of our democracy by using the courts, legislatures, media, and every other tool available at the state and federal level.

As part of that mission, VoteShield is focused on analyzing voter data as a way to monitor the entire election cycle – not just what happens on election day – to ensure free and fair elections. We believe complete and accurate data are a crucial component of well-run elections. Well-run, transparent elections build voter confidence, and voter confidence is critical to a strong democracy.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote
Job_Description:
Company Description
Eikon Therapeutics is a new biopharmaceutical company employing revolutionary technology at the intersection of chemistry, engineering, computation, and biology to discover novel treatments for life-threatening diseases. Eikon’s discovery platform is built on groundbreaking innovations from its founders (Nobel Prize, 2014), culminating in the creation of microscopes which enable real time, molecular-resolution measurements of protein movement in living cells, thereby unlocking otherwise intractable classes of proteins as drug targets.
The parallel development of custom engineering solutions commensurate with the groundbreaking nature of this discovery platform, to enable the collection, analysis, and understanding of the large, high-content datasets that these microscopes produce, is key to Eikon’s mission of discovering new life-saving drugs.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote

Every great story has a new beginning. We're excited to announce that Discovery and WarnerMedia have combined to become Warner Bros. Discovery. The Job
We have created a new Data Analytics & Insights (DAI) group within Warner Brothers Discovery Direct-To-Consumer organization to make the streaming products more data-driven. This team is looking to hire a motivated Sr. Data Engineer who will be working closely with team of highly motivated data engineers to build a state-of-the-art data platform to solve various data-driven use cases across the organization. This platform will host various data products such as but not limited to, Subscription, Content, and Product Analytics, Personalization and Recommendation, Marketing & Ad-Sales enablement. You will be working on flagship direct to consumer products such as HBOMAX and Discovery Plus. You will be charged with building and maintaining various marketing focused data pipelines - handles both streaming and batch data processing. You will be helping data engineers, analysts, and scientists perform their functions by building highly scalable capabilities across the platform. This individual will bring in his/her expertise in a wide variety of big data processing frameworks (both open source and proprietary), large scale database systems (OLAP and OLTP), stream data processing, API Development, Machine learning operationalization, and cloud automation to build and support all the data needs across Warner Brothers Discovery platform.

Every great story has a new beginning. We're excited to announce that Discovery and WarnerMedia have combined to become Warner Bros. Discovery. WBD is a premier global media and entertainment company offering audiences the world’s most differentiated and complete portfolio of content, brands and franchises across television, film, sports, news, streaming and gaming. We’re home to the world’s best storytellers, creating world-class products for consumers. From brilliant creatives to technology trailblazers and beyond, join us as we step into the next chapter.
About the Role

Passionate about cutting edge technologies and working at a global scale? Eager to lead a team responsible for shipping features that have a huge customer reach and can impact millions of users? We are looking for a Software Development Manager to join our Warner Bros. Discovery Commerce team. As a leader, you will influence the company's strategic direction, and partner with Product Management to delight our customers. You will lead a team in breaking down complex projects into specific goals and tasks, while ensuring the long-term vision is delivered. You are action oriented and prioritize delivering roadmap items, proactively identify gaps, as well as opportunities in engineering and operations excellence.






In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles that will be performed in New York City. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $165,900.00 - $308,100.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@warnermedia.com.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote
Job_Description:
Stack Overflow empowers the world to develop technology through collective knowledge. More than 100 million people visit Stack Overflow every month, making it one of the most-visited websites in the world.
Best known for its public platform, Stack Overflow helps people find the answers they need, when they need them. That includes serving up relevant technologies to the community through Stack Overflow Advertising, providing direct access to technology-specific subject matter experts with Collectives™, sharing more about companies as future employers, and helping teams scale with its market-leading knowledge sharing and collaboration platform, Stack Overflow for Teams.
The Data Platform team at Stack Overflow builds and maintains the data processing and analytic pipelines that democratize access to data across our organization. Your cross-functional team will optimize flow and collection of all of our product and business data, enabling data at scale for Stack Overflow. You'll ensure that our data delivery architecture is optimized and consistent, enabling software engineers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists to do their best work.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote
Job_Description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of New York
Working at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You will work in an environment with a diverse group of experienced professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems.

The Bank believes in work flexibility to balance the demands of work and life while also connecting and collaborating with our colleagues in person. Employees can expect to be in the office a couple of days per week as needed for meetings and team collaboration and should live within a commutable distance.
What we do:
The Data and Analytics chapter in the Technology Group builds data products that provide the organization with analytical capabilities in support of its mission. Reporting to the chapter lead for Data and Analytics, you will be part of a diverse, dynamic, and agile squad that is responsible for data pipelines, data integration, data quality, data visualization, self-service analytics and data catalog for the enterprise.

Title: Senior Product Manager, Data Platform - Remote

Company Description

About us, but we’ll be brief:
Experian is the world’s leading global information services company. During life’s big moments – from buying a home or a car, to sending a child to college, to growing a business by connecting with new customers – we empower consumers and our clients to manage their data with confidence. We help individuals to take financial control and access financial services, businesses to make smarter decisions and thrive, lenders to lend more responsibly, and organizations to prevent identity fraud and crime.

We have 20,000 people operating across 44 countries and every day we’re investing in new technologies, talented people, and innovation to help all our clients maximize every opportunity.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Senior Analyst - Quality Analytics
Clinical Shared Services is seeking a Senior Data Analyst with a problem-solving mindset to join our team to support External Quality Programs here at NYP. The incumbent will be responsible for implementing and maintaining data systems to better understand our Coding and Documentation Improvement performance. The position will be involved with external entities and programs such as US News and World Report, CMS, 3M, and Vizient to name a few. The analyst will be responsible for understanding program content, the development of data models, dashboards and clinical information management systems that disseminates results from these external entities. The role will be a part of a group of thoughtful and diverse quality analytics professionals who work closely with our larger clinical and operational team stakeholders and support their efforts.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Role Description At Dropbox, our leaders, our People team, and our business stakeholders understand the power of using data to shape our HR and Recruiting strategies.
Our People Analytics team has made significant investments in our data warehouse and infrastructure, and we ve launched a suite of HR and Recruiting dashboards to empower our internal customers.
Now, we re looking for someone to take our self-service dashboarding capabilities to the next level through world-class visualizations, proactive alerts, enhanced performance, and multi-data source metrics.
You bring the ability to take a holistic approach to the wide-variety of People data needs across Dropbox.
You re able to balance multiple priorities, deep analytical rigor, and excellent interpersonal skills that can be tailored to cross-functional audiences at every level.
You also love what you do, possess a positive, let s make it work mindset, and can thrive under pressure.
Responsibilities Lead Tableau dashboard development efforts within Dropbox s People Analytics team, specifically focused on Recruiting dashboards Partner with stakeholders across Dropbox to understand data needs, define solutions, and visualize a wide variety of Recruiting & HR metrics Develop prototypes, mock-ups, and conceptualization of ideas that bring simplicity and context to complex design challenges Build analytics capabilities through data literacy trainings focused on storytelling with data, and leveraging dashboards to take action Leverage and improve upon our internal data warehouse through partnership with other technical teams at Dropbox and external consultants Develop, consolidate, and improve our self-service HR and Recruiting dashboards based on user feedback Requirements 3-5 years of experience building data visualizations in Tableau with a portfolio of intuitive, interactive dashboards Expertise in leveraging complex data sources to visually represent business metrics Ability to quickly prototype and transform ideas into high-quality work product Strong communication skills and ability to articulate complex solutions well to both technical and non-technical audiences Low ego attitude with a willingness to shift from high-level critical thinking to stepping in and helping to drive implementation alongside functional teams Knowledge of HR and Recruiting processes Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of experience in dashboard development and data visualizations 2+ years of experience working in the HR/Recruiting space 2+ years of experience in enterprise data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake) 2+ years of experience managing and analyzing structured and unstructured data using SQL, R, and/or Python Experience working in an agile development environment Total Rewards For candidates hired in Colorado, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $99,300 - $116,800 - $134,300.
This salary/OTE range represents the low, middle, and high end of the salary or OTE (Sales roles) range for this position, and is subject to change.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
SQL Data Analyst
Headquartered in New York, the Claims Conference is a global, non-profit organization committed to providing a small measure of justice to Holocaust Survivors. Since our founding in 1951, the Claims Conference has secured more than $90 billion from the German government in indemnification for Survivors. In 2021, the Claims Conference distributed approximately $625 million in direct compensation to over 260,000 survivors in 83 countries and allocated approximately $640 million in grants to over 300 social service agencies worldwide that provide vital services for Holocaust survivors, such as home care, food, and medicine. Our Research, Education, and Documentation (RED) funds contribute toward global efforts to educate the public and preserve the memory of the Holocaust through teacher training programs, exhibitions, and films such as Son of Saul, an Academy Award winner for Best Foreign Film. At the Claims Conference, we honor history while making history.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Role Description Product managers set the vision for our growing family of products.
We re responsible for guiding multidisciplinary teams toward a common goal: shipping high quality products and creating business value.
As advocates for both our users and our business, the best product managers balance a range of functional perspectives and empower their teams to do great, high impact work.
As the Lead Product Manager for a new Dropbox product, you will be helping customers instantly find content and information across all of their tools, evolving from a search engine to an answering engine.
You will be focused on crafting experiences for our end users by executing projects with engineers, designers, analysts and marketers in a fast-paced outcome-oriented environment.
The role requires a mix of search expertise, analytical horsepower, relentless execution, and well-honed customer judgment.
You will be responsible for leading the development of the end-to-end search experience cross-platform.
Responsibilities Build a powerful product that s easy to learn, simple to use, and grows to meet its users complex needs.
Lead and guide Search product direction for a fast-moving cross-functional team of engineering, design, analytics, and research Be the voice of the customer and help provide context, empathy and rationale behind customer needs.
Less customer wants a feature , more they want to solve a problem that helps with ..
Realize big, impactful initiatives from start to finish, articulating a vision, gathering and scoping requirements, planning and coordinating development, and shipping iterative improvements.
Make data-informed decisions. Know how you re measuring success before starting any project.
Obsess over your KPIs. Know when to commit more or less resources.
Communicate clearly and crisply with leadership stakeholders and drive alignment across multiple teams in scrappy ways.
Launch highly visible, well documented features and improvements with pace and quality, collaborating with marketing, support, customer success, and sales.
Define new product goals working closely with engineers, designers, senior leaders, and other PMs.
Requirements 5+ years of experience delivering highly successful and innovative software products Entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment, while building extensible and scalable solutions.
You can turn ambiguous problems and big ideas into a roadmap of features, experiments, and research with minimal guidance.
Flawless product craft and product intuition; expert in balancing user and business impact as well as short- and long-term impact.
Build alignment and listen well, but can also drive hard decisions, framing the different options and tradeoffs.
You push the pace. You take blame and pass the praise.
People love working with you. Proven ability to lead teams and work cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment Ability to analyze and use quantitative and qualitative data to inform decisions A deep understanding and empathy for end-users you love building products that make our customers feel joy, delight and trust You re a strong communicator, with an ability to influence with cross-functional collaboration skills Total Rewards For candidates hired in Colorado, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $173,400 - $204,000 - $234,600.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Reporting into the SVP, Technology & Data, the Data Analyst is the first dedicated data analytics role at Geopath. With the support of Geopath’s data scientists and teams, the Data Analyst will build the company’s future data analytics business.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Manage, catalog, and assess the quality of external data sources
Manage Geopath’s audience measurements data suites by supporting the data integrity across all data product releases and creating quality reports for each of the data products
Analyze and generate insights from historical and real time data sources to identify local and national market trends
Use statistical tools or machine learning techniques to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets to support problem diagnosis and future predictions

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Summary/Objective
This is a full-time, research investigations position that requires an individual to fulfill multiple roles during daily office operations and within a project. This role conducts comprehensive open source and public records background investigations for private clients, often in support of anticipated or ongoing litigation, and other investigative matters, as assigned. This role provides project management support by keeping track of project phases and ensuring work product effectiveness and proper completion.
Essential Functions
Conduct background investigations and other investigative assignments using open source intelligence (OSINT) research techniques and other intelligence gathering tools including LexisNexis, Westlaw, etc.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Role Description The Data Platform team's mission is to help power growth for Dropbox through trustworthy and easy to use data.
Our technologies power business insights, analytics, reporting, machine learning, and data applications across the company.
As a Data Platform Product Manager, you will be responsible for defining the strategy, and developing a delightful user flow with the right tools that are used to generate, manage, and consume data at Dropbox.
Our teams will deliver on that vision so that everyone at dropbox can easily leverage the power of our data.
We are seeking an experienced, product manager who is passionate about developing delightful data workflows, and defining the the future products for how data is generated and used.
You will own the tools, infrastructure, and processes, that empowers our analysts, data engineers and scientists to rapidly convert activity on the Dropbox platform to actionable insights powering decision making in the company.
You will be responsible for defining how data becomes easy to use and discover at Dropbox, as well as the roadmap for how we get there.
Responsibilities Establish the future for data engineering products.
Think outside of the box and encourage others to do the same.
Lead large, cross-functional groups of engineers across Data Strategy, Data Platform, and Data Engineering to deliver on our mission.
Build alignment across product teams, cross-functional partners (FP&A, Marketing, Operations, Customer Experience, Data Science, etc.)
and Leadership/Executive team Be efficient at execution and shipping products that solve technical and operational problems for our users.
Be effective and communicating clearly and concisely with engineering and product leadership, and influence our technical strategy Develop the product roadmap and build alignment on prioritization to drive product execution Create processes for collecting feedback from users, and prioritizing requests across business stakeholders Define OKRs to inform product success and health Requirements 10+ years of experience as a Product Manager Experience in crafting and helping build improving data productivity, quality, and automating/optimizing data workflows.
Proven ability to work cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment Passion to understand customer needs and a strong motivation to solve their problems Demonstrated empathy for key data management pain points, and a track record of leadership in building products for data engineers or data scientists Strong analytical skills to make data-driven decisions You care about diversity and contribute to a psychologically safe environment for all our employees, customers, and partners.
Strong understanding of technical architecture and data infrastructure principles Experience with establishing product process Experience with managing complex cross team prioritization Total Rewards For candidates hired in Colorado, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $153,000 - $180,000 - $207,000.
This salary/OTE range represents the low, middle, and high end of the salary or OTE (Sales roles) range for this position, and is subject to change.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Role Description Dropbox is looking for a Senior FP&A Systems Analyst to join our Corporate FP&A Systems team.
As the senior systems analyst, you will play a critical role in supporting the FP&A function by reducing work about work and enabling the team to focus on high-level value-adding efforts.
You will support monthly forecast cycles, work on high impact projects, and troubleshoot any systems-related issues all while becoming a trusted and strategic partner for the broader FP&A team.
You will also provide best-fit architectural solutions for our current state and help lead us into the future of more automated processes and better reporting packages.
Since this role is embedded into Dropbox s FP&A team, you should also be able to understand and decipher financial statements (Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement, etc.)
as well as have a solid understanding of common financial processes (including financial close cycles, budgeting and planning processes, and recurring reporting requests).
The ideal candidate is independent and accountable, is always looking to leverage their technical skills to improve processes and analyses, and is naturally inclined to troubleshoot issues and resolve challenges.
Responsibilities Own and aggressively drive forward the technology architecture of our Financial Planning systems by leading process improvement initiatives and collaborating with partners on ad-hoc systems projects and reports Interact effectively with Finance and Accounting stakeholders to define leading business processes in Budgeting, Forecasting, and Performance Management functional areas Provide Architectural assessments, strategies, and roadmaps for Oracle EPM Products like Budgeting & Planning (PBCS), Enterprise Data Management (EDM), Cloud Data Management (CDM), Account Reconciliation (ARCS), Financial Consolidation & Close (FCCS), Profitability & Cost Management (PCMCS), and Enterprise Narrative Reporting Act as the first line of defense for production issues and a go-to resource for all financial systems, including the ability to assist in data reconciliations to maintain data integrity Support the monthly forecast and outlook cycles and act as the functional administrator for Dropbox's planning and reporting systems, including monthly COA management using Oracle EDMCS Support and enhance current state automation jobs (using Dell Boomi or OneCloud) and reports and dashboards (using Oracle Analytics Cloud and Tableau) Requirements 5+ years of progressive finance systems experience with a strong understanding of end-to-end planning processes Direct experience as a functional administrator for Oracle PBCS (covering Operating Expenses, Workforce, and CapEx with SmartView implementation), with ability to write calculation scripts and maintain business rules in Planning and/or Essbase Extensive knowledge in data sourcing strategies using ETL, REST API calls, Google Big Query, etc., using tools like ODI, Informatica, OneCloud, Dell Boomi, or similar tools Development experience in scripting with Python/Groovy, setting up data integrations using APIs, and using EPM Automate and Batch Scripting Experience building metadata, designing web forms, conducting data reconciliation, and building dashboards, preferably in Tableau or Oracle Analytics Cloud Strong team player who is willing to teach others, as well as the ability to work independently and be accountable for individual results Total Rewards For candidates hired in Colorado, the expected salary/On-Target Earnings (OTE) range for the role is $88,400 - $104,000 - $119,600.
This salary/OTE range represents the low, middle, and high end of the salary or OTE (Sales roles) range for this position, and is subject to change.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
POSITION
Data Analyst

LOCATION
This position is available to Virginia residents as Richmond or Lynchburg, Virginia in-office applicants or remote applicants residing in states/locations under Eastern or Central Standard Time: Alabama, Arkansas, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Washington DC, Vermont, West Virginia or Wisconsin.
At Genworth, we are committed to caring for our customers and for the safety of our colleagues. In the event the office is inaccessible (i.e. Inclement Weather), this role may be required to work remotely.


The Data Analyst to join our expanding problem-solving team will be supporting our Long Term Care Claims Operations department and will help drive business strategy and solve complex problems. This individual will harness the power of data to better forecast trends, build dashboards that measure effectiveness/efficiency, provide cost benefit analysis, drive capacity planning, and project impact all while getting to present findings/insights to the leadership team.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
The Associate Principal Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the establishment and maintenance of controls related to Member Supervision Records, Data Privacy and Entitlement Management programs and operations. Collaborate with Member Supervision stakeholders, enterprise records, data privacy and entitlement groups, and lead or assist with initiatives, to resolve or mitigate issues.
Essential Job Functions:
Provide essential support to the Information Manager for Member Supervision. Assist in implementing firm and department policies and procedures related to information classification, safeguarding of confidential information, establishing and administering related controls, reviewing and triaging loss reports and other applicable information management guidelines.
Provide essential support to the Records Manager for Member Supervision. Assist with related responsibilities such as responding to records related questions from Member Supervision staff, facilitating periodic records destruction processes, and maintaining documentation related to updates to official records.
Annual Salary: $72,400.00 - $129,600.00

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:

Research required data.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
ABOUT US
SportsMEDIA Technology – (SMT) is the pioneer in sports technology, having re-imagined the fan experience 30 years ago. Since then, we’ve revolutionized how sports fans watch their favorite events, whether in the stands, livestreaming or on television. Through innovative real-time and wireless data and display systems, SMT’s impact is evident in every major international sport on the world’s stage, from football and soccer to tennis and golf. Along the way, SMT has grown to become the premier technology provider for pinnacle world-renowned events, including the tennis Grand Slams, golf majors, the Olympics, NHL, NBA, the New York City Marathon and CrossFit Games. SMT designed and developed the official scoring, statistics, and onsite live presentation systems for the NBA, the NHL, the PGA TOUR, NASCAR, the CrossFit Games, all four golf majors, and the four tennis slams.
SMT services hundreds of major U.S and international sports events, as well as major sports broadcasters, teams and organizing bodies, resulting in a sports technology powerhouse unequaled in the industry. SMT continues to blaze the trail in sports technology with innovative biometrics and player and object tracking, mobile apps, analytics, video production services, wireless information systems, and on-site services. SMT’s products have become a regular part of the viewing experience for fans and an invaluable asset for clients. SMT's growth has led to the creation of several divisions, with divisions in Durham, NC, Fremont, CA, Jacksonville, FL, and Toronto, Canada.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
** These roles require some experience with Credit Analysis or Risk Analysis in the Financial Services industry** These roles, which will be Excel intensive are ideal for candidates with 2-3 years experience..
Role Purpose: Assist SVP and Head of Risk Management in formulating and implementing risk management techniques to control market and liquidity risk exposures of the Bank.
Duties will include:
- Formulating risk management techniques to control risk exposures in the areas of market and liquidity risks that are directly related to the Branch’s activities; implement risk limits, guidelines and other parameters to be used to monitor the risk exposures and report any breaches and exceptions in a timely manner.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
The Program
Our training program kicks off with an orientation providing you with the opportunity to learn about Macquarie business groups across the Americas. You will also have opportunities to meet your peers and expand your network.

On the desk, you’ll be given meaningful and challenging work. You’ll be encouraged to examine problems from every angle, challenge the status quo and come up with new and innovative ways of progressing our business while being supported by a diverse team. We know success comes from encouraging our people to think differently so regardless of your level, if you have ideas that have merit, we’ll give you the opportunity to develop and test them to see where they can lead.

Your role
With our Client Solutions Group (CSG), you will have an opportunity to make a real and sustainable difference. We invest in businesses that create impact and support communities – aiming to add real and lasting value for our clients and the people our assets service. The projects you’ll work on will make a difference.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
At Popular, we offer a wide variety of services and financial solutions to serve our communities in Puerto Rico, United States & Virgin Islands. As employees, we are dedicated to making our customers dreams come true by offering financial solutions in each stage of their life. Our extensive trajectory demonstrates the resiliency and determination of our employees to innovate, reach for the right solutions and strongly support the communities we serve; this is why we value their diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds.

Are you ready for a rewarding career?
Over 8,000 people in Puerto Rico, United States and Virgin Islands work at Popular.
Come and join our community!

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Join Macquarie’s Commodity and Global Markets, Credit Markets Division as a Loan Closing and Operations Analyst.
In this role, where you will be part of a dynamic team that supports a portfolio of structured asset backed loans and the direct lending market. On a day-to-day basis, you will work directly with originators, credit risk, legal and other members of the Macquarie Group in the deal formation, structuring and approval phase of lending and structured transactions. Sitting on the trading floor, you will be immersed within the day-to-day business operations and have an opportunity to leverage your subject matter expertise in the leverage loans space alongside our sales and lending team.
In this role, you will deliver through a hands-on approach directly supporting the front office, drafting trade documents, working directly with clients, and assisting them throughout the lending process. You will have daily interaction with the front office and be responsible for seeing transactions end to end, ensuring deals are booked, documents are drafted and liaising with the back office and clients to ensure transactions are executed and settled on-time. You will also have daily interaction with external clients while you work through the document negotiation and drafting process alongside our legal team. Possessing a strong professional image and communication style will ensure that you are successful in this role.

What we are looking for

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
A part of a global team trading in a wide range of steel products. The Risk Management (RM) team is seeking additional staff in our New York City office.
Responsibilities include:
· Conducting a trade risk assessment of customers, suppliers, including analysis of the steel industry, focusing on North and South American markets.
· Monitoring Company’s business operation from a risk management perspective.
· Managing the credit operations, insurance, and commercial legal matters.
· Supervising department level credit administration activities such as the credit application and data base management.

Title: Director, Data Management

· Producing and providing first level analysis of reports for Conflict Check Requests relating to new business, new clients, lateral attorney candidates and business development purposes

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Must haves:
-3-5 Years of Experience as a Data Analyst
-3+ years of experience working with (DOMO, Tableau, PowerBI, ThoughtSpot)
-Strong experience working with SQL
-3+ Years of Experience with Python scripting
-Experience utilizing data visualization tools and an overall understanding of Data Analytics
Day to Day:
A nonprofit & insurance focused company is looking for a Product Analyst to join their ITS group. This person will be working alongside one other Data Analyst to assist with production support tools and visualization as it pertains to the business. They will need to have a strong background within SQL and experience working with either Tableau or Domo for building out reports for the business. They may be involved in project meetings and identifying and resolving issues as they come up within the organization. This person will need to have a strong understanding of data analytics and additionally experience working with large data sets.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Assess processes, determine requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports
Participate in maintenance of the corporate Data Warehouse and ETL system
Coordinate the development and testing of new features or changes to reports
Manage incoming support tickets and ad-hoc reporting requests
Review and update existing documentation
Support various internal and external data interfaces
Match data sets from multiple sources and clean up existing data
Ability to analyze business process and make recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with ERP development team to advise and support the application landscape

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Hi, we're Oscar. We're hiring a Data Scientist I, Risk Analytics to join our team.
Oscar is the first health insurance company built around a full stack technology platform and a relentless focus on serving our members. We started Oscar in 2012 to create the kind of health insurance company we would want for ourselves—one that behaves like a doctor in the family.
About the role
Create strong partnerships with internal teams at Oscar to build out and leverage key data science insights that directly impact our members
Discover, understand, and organize disparate data sources and structure them into clean data models that unlock self-service analytics for internal teams
Work with stakeholders to evaluate existing programs and drive improvements through data-driven methods, as well as support the development of data-driven hypotheses

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Risk Analyst (Hybrid)
Build Your Career | Love your Work | Make a Difference
Payoneer's mission is to empower businesses to go beyond – beyond borders, limits and expectations. In today's digital world, Payoneer enables any business of any size from anywhere to access new economic opportunities by making it possible to transact as easily globally as they do locally.
Payoneer's digital platform streamlines global commerce for millions of small businesses, marketplaces and enterprises from 200 countries and territories. Leveraging its robust technology, compliance, operations and banking infrastructure, Payoneer delivers a suite of services that includes cross-border payments, working capital, tax solutions, merchant services and risk management. Powering growth for customers ranging from aspiring entrepreneurs in emerging markets to the world's leading digital brands like Airbnb, Amazon, Google and Upwork, Payoneer makes global commerce easy and secure. Founded in 2005, Payoneer is profitable and has a team based all around the world.

Title: Director, Data Management
Job_Description:
Company Overview
Every great story has a new beginning. We're excited to announce that Discovery and WarnerMedia have combined to become Warner Bros. Discovery. WBD is a premier global media and entertainment company offering audiences the world’s most differentiated and complete portfolio of content, brands and franchises across television, film, sports, news, streaming and gaming. We’re home to the world’s best storytellers, creating world-class products for consumers. From brilliant creatives to technology trailblazers and beyond, join us as we step into the next chapter.
Job Summary
Warner Bros. Discovery's DTC technology and product organization sits at the intersection of tech, entertainment, and everyday utility. We are continuously leveraging new technology to build immersive and interactive viewing experiences. Our platform covers everything from search, catalog, and video transcoding, to personalization, global subscriptions, and more. We are committed to delivering quality user experiences, ranging from video streaming to applications across connected TV, mobile, web and consoles. As a pure tech organization, we are essential to Warner Bros. Discovery’s continued growth, building world-class products from the ground-up for our iconic brands like HBO Max, Discovery Channel, CNN, Food Network, HGTV, Eurosport, MotorTrend, and many more.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles that will be performed in New York City. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $150,500.00 - $279,500.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@warnermedia.com.

Title: Director, Data Management

We are Farmers!
